wikipedia_page.main: William Henry Margetson  (London December 1861 – 2 January 1940) was a British painter and illustrator, mainly known for his aesthetic portraits of women.

response: thumb|left|"In the morning one of these ladies came to Gawaine." William Henry Margetson's illustration for Legends of King Arthur and His Knights (1914)
* James Thomas Knowles published Le Morte d'Arthur as The Legends of King Arthur and His Knights in 1860. It has been subsequently illustrated by William Henry Margetson.
*William Henry Margetson (1861–1940), British painter and illustrator

On 20 Jun 1889 Hatton married fellow artist William Henry Margetson in London. Her husband died in 1940 and she died on 24 October 1955, aged 96, at the Thames Bank Nursing Home in Goring-on-Thames, Oxfordshire.UK Government Probate Search

Stella Margetson was born in Hampstead in London in 1912,England & Wales, Civil Registration Birth Index, 1837-1915 for Stella Margetson: 1912, Q1-Jan-Feb-Mar - Ancestry.com  the youngest of three children of Laurence Margetson (1874–1928), a hosiery manufacturer,England & Wales, Civil Registration Marriage Index, 1837-1915 for Florence Collingbourne: 1902, Q2-Apr-May-Jun - Ancestry.com  and the actress, singer and stage beauty Florence Collingbourne (1880-1946).Ada Reeve (1876-1966) - Stage Beauty website1911 England Census for Florence Margetson: London, Hampstead - Ancestry.com  She was descended from the artist and illustrator William Henry Margetson and the novelist and journalist Joseph Hatton.
